title: Gotcha: AOC Has a Plan to Finally Catch Republicans Doing What Some Have Expected All Along
text:
New York Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez has a plan: She intends to expose Republicans in Congress, bringing to light what has — it would appear — been so far kept in darkness. AOC wants to finally prove that the GOP endorses Donald Trump.

At least, that’s how it sounds.

Speaking to reporters, the 29-year-old insisted the President must be impeached even if his ousting fails; she wants every Republican to be shown as a worshipper of the devil. I mean, supporter of the President.

Does she mean exactly the way Democrats supported Clinton when he was impeached? Like that way?

Judge for yourself.

Here’s what she had to say:

“[I] think that once the House impeaches, the House has impeached the President.”

Let’s let that one stew for a moment…

I’ve just put on my white coat…I’ve entered the laboratory…

And I’m testing the veracity of that statement right at this very moment…

Yeah — yeah, I guess she’s right.

Continuing:

“[T]hen that hearing goes to the Senate. If they want to fail it, then I want to see every Republican go on the record and knowingly vote against impeachment of this president — knowing his corruption, having it on the record, so that they can have that stay on their careers for the rest of their lives. Because this it outrageous, to protect the amount of lawlessness…”

She wants it all on the record.

Take with me, if you will, a stroll down memory lane. Let’s skip along to, maybe a little over five months ago…

Here’s a tweet from the same person as above:

The GOP’s whole game of wasting votes in Congress to target others “on the record”, for leg they have no intent to pass, is a disgrace. Stop wasting the American peoples’ time + learn to govern. Our jobs aren’t for campaigning, & that’s exactly what these bluff-votes are for. https://t.co/ELzpQhlezo — Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez (@AOC) March 23, 2019

And that, my friends, is called “politics.”

Like…maybe the same system in which, given that we have a two-party setup, one party will defend their highest ranking member if he/she is attacked — or impeached — by the other party.

AOC’s Twittering, by the way, was in response to Mitch McConnell’s move to put up the cowfart fighter’s Green New Deal for a vote in the Senate (catch the hilarity here).

As for Donald Trump’s “lawlessness,” this seems to be brought up quite a bit. Curiously, it doesn’t appear to frequently be combined with evidence of such.

But it’s all terribly true. Just ask Rob Reiner (here):

The Impeachment process is about to begin. The articles drawn up will be voluminous. Never in our nation’s history has there been a more lawless President. He has continually lied to the American people & has used the Presidency to line his pockets. GOP, history is watching. — Rob Reiner (@robreiner) September 7, 2019

But honestly, what I think is much worse is DT’s abject racism and the reality that, although the executive branch is limited in power, and we live in a democratic republic, and there are checks and balances, and Congress passes our laws, and any given presidency can only last two terms at most…despite all that, Donald John Trump, through sheer tyranny of will, is about to destroy all of humanity. Maybe that’s why all the Republicans are hiding their very secretive support of him.

This is, in fact, unarguable:

It is unarguable, Donald Trump is a racist. If you support him you are supporting racism. At this crucial time in the struggle for the soul of our nation, we all must choose. Either embrace his hatred or fight to overcome original sin. Humanity hangs in the balance. — Rob Reiner (@robreiner) July 15, 2019

-ALEX
